lead_paragraph: Minnesota pitcher Francisco Liriano needs major surgery on his left elbow and is expected to miss the 2007 season. Liriano was told yesterday that his injury required the ligament transplant procedure, which usually requires a year for recovery. Liriano, 23, went 12-3 with a 2.16 earned run average and 144 strikeouts in 121 innings as a rookie.
